casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Appellee, v. Gustave FREEMAN, alias Gustave Frishman, alias Gustave Freymann, alias Freiman, Appellant.* No. 331. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. April 6, 1936. Louis Halle, of New York City (Milton R. Kroopf, of New York City, on the brief), for appellant. Lamar Hardy, U. S. Atty., of New York City (Seymour Miller Klein, Asst. U. S. Atty., and Paul Nulle, Sp. Asst. U. S. Atty., both of New York City, of counsel), for the United States.

Before L. HAND, SWAN, and AUGUSTUS N. HAND, Circuit Judges.

Writ of certiorari denied 66 S. Ct. 957, 80 L. Ed. —.

 PER CURIAM.

Judgment affirmed on the authority of United States v. McGuire, 64 F.(2d) 485 (C.C.A.2).
